title: How to Make Oreo Coffee Ice Cream

steps.headline: Whisk the cream and sweetened condensed milk together until dissolved.
steps.description: Adding both together at the first stage will help you get a better taste. Keep aside.

steps.headline: Mix 1/2 spoon of coffee powder with the 1/2 spoon of cocoa powder.
steps.description: This helps the ice cream achieve a balanced taste of both flavors. Keep aside.

steps.headline: Mix the cream and sweetened condensed milk mixture with coffee powder and cocoa powder mixture.
steps.description: Mix until no granules or flakes of the powder mixture are seen. Add some vanilla essence/bean paste/extract (as per your requirements) and mix.

steps.headline: Put all the Oreos in a resealable bag, and crush them.
steps.description: Crush the Oreo biscuits or cookies uniformly, as you need big and small pieces. (If you don't have Oreo, you can use any other biscuits or cookies that you have at home. The taste will still be great! ).

steps.headline: Add the crushed Oreo biscuits or cookies in the liquid mixture of cream, condensed milk, powders, and essence.
Transfer this mixture to a plastic or glass bowl.
steps.description: Put it in the freezer overnight or for at least 7 to 8 hours.

text: Whisk the cream and sweetened condensed milk together until dissolved. Adding both together at the first stage will help you get a better taste. Keep aside. Mix 1/2 spoon of coffee powder with the 1/2 spoon of cocoa powder. This helps the ice cream achieve a balanced taste of both flavors. Keep aside. Mix the cream and sweetened condensed milk mixture with coffee powder and cocoa powder mixture. Mix until no granules or flakes of the powder mixture are seen. Add some vanilla essence/bean paste/extract (as per your requirements) and mix. Put all the Oreos in a resealable bag, and crush them. Crush the Oreo biscuits or cookies uniformly, as you need big and small pieces. (If you don't have Oreo, you can use any other biscuits or cookies that you have at home. The taste will still be great! ). Add the crushed Oreo biscuits or cookies in the liquid mixture of cream, condensed milk, powders, and essence.  Transfer this mixture to a plastic or glass bowl. Put it in the freezer overnight or for at least 7 to 8 hours. Serve.
